title: sending e-mail in Thunderbird
content: Dear Forum; if I try to send an E-mail from my Thunderbird account it sometimes takes so long (even very short mails) that it is not sent after all. If I try again, it is however immediately send. I never had this problem using Outlook. Is there a way to simply solve this problem? Thanks in advance. Ronald
creator: keus0127

title: Contents of emails don't appear in Message Area
content: I have Thunderbird 102.14.0 installed on a MacOS Catalina 10.15.7. It is set to display the Thunderbird Start Page in the Message Window. But whether this appears in the Message Window or not is temperament - sometimes it does, sometimes it doesn't. Likewise, when I click on an email to open, on those days when the Thunderbird Start has not displayed, the body of the email won't display in the Message Window. I use 3 email accounts with Thunderbird: two are gmail accounts, one is plus.com (a UK provider). When messages don't open in the Message Window, this impacts emails in all 3 accounts. Other than closing down Thunderbird for a while and praying - which sometimes works! - how to I fix this? Many thanks in anticipation of a helpful reply. Cathleen
creator: cgmainds

title: No notifications for participants - calendar

title: "Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead" with Oauth (gmail) account
content:
Hi, The institution where I work makes me change my password. So I did, and I expected TB to ask me the new password (previously of that TB was working fine). Every time it tries to login, I get this message, no matter what I do:

Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead

Thunderbird detected a potential security threat and did not continue to id-provider.uoc.edu. If you visit this site, attackers could try to steal information like your passwords, emails, or credit card details.

What I try:

  • Delete and add the account of the problem
  • delete all the passwords of ALL the accounts and add them again
  • Reinstall TB (recycling prefs.js and all the .MAB files in the profile) (previous version was 102.something, current one is 115.1.1., same problem in both)
  • Make a new profile using the prefs.js of the other laptop (where it works properly)
  • Make a totally new profile just to test the account alone.

Nothing changes, same behavior.

Additional information: In my second laptop it worked fine, I could login easily after changing the password. Is still on 102.14.0, I don't dare update it yet. My institution works with google, so I usually login in my institution and then in google in the popup windows. This is how it works in TB in my other laptop, is the normal behavior. I have 2 more google accounts, and 2 more institutional outlook (microsoft) accounts (another institution). All of them work with Oauth2 perfectly fine. So I know this this is not the problem (I have no internal server in my PC, also). This This didn't help also, but I think is not exactly the same problem, some Oauth2 account works fine in my laptop, is just this one.

So, My guess is that somehow my TB doesn't allow non direct connections to google accounts (through my institution, in this case) and consider it some kind of scam. But it worked in my other laptop, so...

Any help, please? I have a lot of accounts and I need to work with thunderbird to manage them all!

Thank you
creator: fellipecorr

title: Should the filter work on drafts? Messages saved in draft folder are filtered which seems to be wrong
content:
Hello,

when I start to write a mail that has a certain to: address, which is also included in one of my filters to move messages which are sent to me and which meet the criterion to a folder, then my draft saves will be moved to the target folder too, immediately after a draft was automatically saved by Thunderbird to the drafts folder.

I think my filters should not affect the drafts folder.

title: Import mail da Outlook si ferma a 6.033.766.701 byte
content:
Ciao a tutti, sto cercando di importare le email da un profilo Outlook 2021 x64 utilizzando l'ultima versione di Thunderbird (115.1.1). La procedura di import si avvia correttamente e dal Task Manager posso vedere il processo lavorare; il file (C:\Users\xxx\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\xxxx\Mail\Local Folders\Import Outlookxxxx.sbd\xxxxx.sbd) del profilo locale di Thunderbird aumenta di dimensione man mano che vengono importate le email. Dopo diversi minuti però tutto si ferma, il processo smette di lavorare ed il file di import su filesystem si blocca a 6.033.766.701 byte.

Thunderbird non restiuisce messaggi di errore e la finestra di avanzamento resta ferma allo 0%

Il file di origine è un PST da 36GB

Avete qualche suggerimento? Grazie
creator: magnum2000

title: One Message filter for multiple email accounts (one message filter to rule them all)
content:
I use various email addresses to run my business. For example -A general correspondence email, invoice email, events email and a bookings email. These have multiple folders and I use message filters to file correspondence into various folders. Currently there is no easy way to write one message filter rule and apply it to multiple email addresses. I can send corresponded from one email address to another using the filter but to manage multiple chains of correspondence from the same client, I have to write the same rule into all the email accounts separately. My dream is to write one message filter and select the email accounts to apply this one rule too.

I want to be able to apply one rule to rule them all.

For example - Spam - I currently have a message filter that grabs 16 plus phrases and sends them to spam but i have to create this rule multiple times for multiple email addresses - i should be able to apply it to all or a select number of email addresses. Can anyone help
creator: leegunn1471

title: Thunderbird 102.14.0 e-mails to gmail accounts are getting rejected because authentification failed
content: I have tried to follow the instructions to set the Authentification method to outgoing SMTP to OAuth2, but there was no such option on my Thunderbird. I then set the Authentification method to "Password, transmitted insecurely", but then Thunderbird produced a window saying, "login to account 'outgoing SMTP' failed" and telling me "Login to server mail.whiteboxtechnologies.com with username [edited] @whiteboxtechnologies.com failed" and to either Retry, Enter New Password, or Cancel. All passwords I tried were rejected. How can I either set the Authentification method to OAuth2, or enter the correct password? Are there cookies that I need to clear out ?
creator: joehuang

title: PCV profile import to Thunderbird from MozBackup
content: I have reinstalled a profile that was backed up on MozBackup as a .pcv file. This displays the contents of each email folder. However, when I click on most of the individual email messages, most of them have no data: I can see sender, subject, date/time, but not the actual message.
